foods.name: Irio
foods.description: Irio means food in the Kikuyu language. It’s made of mashed potatoes, maize, and peas or greens in some variations.

foods.name: Sukuma Wiki
foods.description: This rustic Kenyan vegetable dish is made chiefly of a leafy vegetable similar to kale called colewort or collared greens, which is sukuma in Swahili.

foods.name: Ugali
foods.description: Cornmeal poured into boiling water and consistently mixed until it thickens and reaches a dough-like consistency.

foods.name: Githeri
foods.description: Githeri is also a humble dish. Also called muthere or mutheri, githeri is made of maize and beans mixed and stewed in a pot or sufuria.

foods.name: Mukimo
foods.description: It’s made with mashed potatoes and greens with corn and/or beans. It goes well as a side for stews and grilled meat like nyama choma.

foods.name: Bhajias
foods.description: They’re made with thinly sliced potatoes coated in a gram flour batter seasoned with herbs and spices like cumin, coriander, parsley, chili powder, and ginger.

foods.name: Matoke
foods.description: Matoke refers to both the fruit and the dish made from unripe highland bananas. They’re often prepared in a stew on their own or as part of a heavier meal with beef.

foods.name: Nyama Choma
foods.description: lightly seasoned roasted meat. Goat is the meat of choice for nyama choma but it can be made with beef as well.

foods.name: Beef stew
foods.description: For some, this Kenyan stew made with beef is the ultimate comfort food. It consists of meltingly tender chunks of beef braised in a tomato-coconut broth with garlic, onions,

foods.name: Chapati
foods.description: Chapati is another Kenyan staple dish derived from Indian cuisine. It refers to a type of unleavened flatbread that’s become popular in Kenya and other countries in East Africa like Uganda, Tanzania, Zanzibar, and Burundi

foods.name: Kenyan Pilau
foods.description: It seems that rice meals run aplenty in Kenya, and one of the best-tasting is pilau. It’s a Kenyan staple dish that’s widespread in Eastern Africa. Considered as the Kenyan and more celebrated version of Nigeria’s jollof rice,

foods.name: French Fries
foods.description: They are prepared by cutting potatoes into even strips, drying them, and frying them, usually in a deep fryer.
